snippet: DeGrom, one of the Mets’ fine young pitchers, declined to sign his contract, an act of protest because it was not really negotiable.
abstract: New York Mets pitcher Jacob deGrom, in act of protest, declines to sign contract despite collective bargaining agreement that will force him to accept $607,000 salary; deGrom is one of most promising pitchers in league, but will not be eligible for arbitration until following season, and will not gain free agency until after 2020.
lead_paragraph: DeGrom, one of the Mets’ fine young pitchers, declined to sign his contract, an act of protest because it was not really negotiable.

headline.main: Mets’ Jacob deGrom Reluctantly Accepts $607,000 Salary for 2016
headline.print_headline: DeGrom Isn’t Happy With Salary, but Larger Paydays Await
